intro: Sarcoglottis neglecta, commonly known as the neglected sarcoglottis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Menispermaceae. It is characterized by its climbing habit and has palmately lobed leaves that are typically green and glossy. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elliptical, winged fruits. Native to tropical regions of Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
